issues.summary: Stage - Accounts Payable - CXML Invoice Returning from EH - CXML Invoice is Not being Matched with the Structured/Coding WF when one exists in case Enhanced WF is toggled ON from DB.
issues.description: URL: https://devqa5-go.vroozi.com Username:  asma.latif+APM83@vroozi.com Password: Blueangel1! / Blueangel1@ PreCondition: Enhanced WF should be toggled ON in DB>Feature toggles collection. Auto Processing of CXML documents should be ON in Accounts Payable>Settings>Preferences Page. Ordered PO should exist. CXML Invoice request should have been submitted. Steps: Ensure CXML Invoice is in Exception status and assigned to the Requester/Buyer Or to the group , set  for it. Login as Requester and Resolve the exceptions and submit. Since the Invoice is falling under an Incoming rule it should go to the users of that rule. Invoice is returning to  APMs Only. Actual Results: CXML Invoice is Not being Matched with the Structured WF when one exists in case Enhanced WF is toggled ON from DB. Expected Results: It should always work correctly with and without Enhanced WF. Test Data: DevQA5.83  = 9000002645 Thanks, Asma

issues.summary: Maersk Dynamic Work Flow : When Requester Do A POCR and copy 1st line item then wrong workflow appears in stair case
issues.description: Maersk Dynamic work flow : When Requester Do A POCR and copy 1st line item then wrong workflow appears in stair case Case: 2 Workflow created  1 WF----> Combination 1------>Mustafa Approver 1=1000,  --->Mustafa Approver  2=1500 2 WF------> Combination 2----> Mustafa Approver 3=2000,  -----Mustafa Approver 4=2500 PR is created with: Line item 1= Combination 1--->WF 1       , Amount=500 Line Item 2=Combination 2---->WF 2      , Amount=3000 Line Item 3=Combination 1--->WF 1        ,Amount =3000 As Workflow implementation it goes to 1st Line item and Moves to Workflow 1. POCR Created with Copy the  1st Line  Item then it moves to WF 1  and with  Updated PO Total  it should go to all  Approvers . Preconditions: 1-Stair Case should be enabled. 2-On documents-->Purchase Order--> Enable Updated PO Total. 3-PO should be created With line items as listed above. 4- ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW__ENHANCED_WORKFLOW  should be enabled. Steps To Replicate : 1-Go to the Relevant PO. 2-Click on fap Icon. 3-Selct Change request. 4-Add or copy the 1st line item same as listed above. 5-Click on  approval hierarchy Expected Result :  it should go to all approvers with in the rule as calculated with updated PO.  Actual Result: it moves to Mustafa Approver 1 along with fallback approver and skips the in between approvers Note:  Video is attached for better understanding. Server:  Production Credentials: ghulam.mustafa@vroozi.com       (Employee) Welcome@1 ghulam.mustafa+fin1@vroozi.com       (Financial Approver1) Welcome@1 ghulam.mustafa+fin2@vroozi.com       (Financial Approver2) ghulam.mustafa+fallback@vroozi.com       (Fall back Approver) Welcome@1 Issue No 2: When there is no Rule Found on the given accounting combination and Fall back approver Edits the PR and make it to the valid combination that is belonging to a specific rule the PR is not going to the approval workflow Preconditions: 1-PR is created with accounting combination that does not belongs to any approval workflow. 2-Log in with fall back approver. Steps To Replicate: 1-Go to Relevant PR. 2-Click on the Edit Button. 3-Edit the accounting info that belongs to any Approval Workflow. 4-Click on approval Hierarchy. Expected Result: PR should move to updated approval hierarchy with respect to addition by the fall back approver. Actual Result: PR is not moving to updated approval workflow by fall back approval.

issues.summary: Approval WF: Enhance Approval Matching Technique to Consider Accounting Combination with Highest Total Amount.
issues.description: Business Case : As an  Admin , I want the system to determine approval rules based on the accounting combination with the  highest total amount  across  all line items , rather than solely relying on the first line item's accounting combination. Acceptance Criteria : What is the change?  Modify the Approval Matching Technique to consider the accounting combination with the  highest total amount  across  all line items , rather than the current implementation where approval rule selection is based solely on the first line item's accounting combination. Which Customer should this change impact?  Customers using the new  Dynamic Approval Workflow  feature toggle and  new BE setting  /  Option (b)  from this ticket -  . Important Notes: The new workflow enhancements will only be enabled for Maersk and Forest Lawn initially. This solution was specifically designed to handle Maersk’s 1st line item matching concerns. For all other customers for whom this will be turned off, the existing functionality will prevail (for both Vroozi Invoice and Purchase). What pages should this change impact?  PR, CR, Invoice, Memo, PRQ. Which users should be impacted by the change?  Admins, Approvers, AP Approvers. How should this change work? Pre-Requisites: Conditions in AC #2 are fulfilled. The Financial Approval Workflow is enabled by the Admin. Overview : The change involves enhancing the Approval Matching Technique to consider the accounting combination with the highest total amount across all line items when determining the appropriate approval rule for a document. Functionality : When a document is submitted for approval, the system should analyze  all line items  to identify unique accounting combinations. For each unique accounting combination, the system should  add up  and calculate the  total amount  associated with all line items containing that combination. The system should take  Split accounting  into consideration as well. The system should then identify the accounting combination with the  highest  total amount. Based on the accounting combination with the highest total amount, the system should select the corresponding approval rule for the document. The Approval Rule matching should be selected based on our current implementation done in this ticket -    Total Amount  =  Calculated Total  ( that takes Unit Price, Quantity, Tax, Shipping and discount into consideration ) Certain Use Cases : If there is  only 1   accounting combination  with the  highest total  amount, then use this accounting combination to determine the closest Approval Rule match. If there are  2 or more  different  accounting combination  with the  same  highest total  amount, then Select the 1st accounting combination in the line item order. Check whether this line item has an Approval rule matching with it or not. If no matching rule found for the 1st accounting combination then select the next accounting combination and check the Approval matching rule against it. Example : Invoice has 5 line items. Line #2 has Split accounting. Each Accounting combination has a total amount related to its respective line item. Line Number Split Accounting Accounting Combination Total amount #1 No CC1 + Cost1 + GL1 $50 #2.1 Yes CC1 + Cost1 + GL2 $25 #2.2 Yes CC1 + Cost2 + GL2 $150 #3 No CC1 + Cost2 + GL2 $65 #4 No CC1 + Cost3 + GL1 + Customer1 $100 #5 No CC1 + Cost1 + GL1 $75 Total amount for each accounting combination added up to - CC1 + Cost1 + GL1 = $50 + $75 = $125 (Line #1 + Line #5) CC1 + Cost1 + GL2 = $25 (Line #2.1) CC1 + Cost2 + GL2  = $150 + $65 =  $215  (Selected) (Line #2.2 + Line #3) CC1 + Cost3 + GL1 + Customer1 = $100 (Line #4) Accounting Combination  CC1 + Cost2 + GL2  should be selected based on the Total amount of  $215 , that is highest amongst other accounting combinations. The system will now try to find the closest Approval rule match against this  Selected  accounting Combination. Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  No. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All. Questions : Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date

issues.summary: Payables: Approval WF: Admin should be able to decide which Approval matching technique they would like to use.
issues.description: Business Case : As an  Admin , I should be able to choose between the  original  ( 1st line item ) matching technique and the  new  ( accounting combination with the highest total amount ) matching technique for approval workflows. Acceptance Criteria : What is the change?  The  Admin  should be able to decide whether the Approval rule matching should be triggered based on the accounting combinations present on the 1st line item or based on the highest total amount after summing it up for each unique accounting combination among all line items on PR, CR, Invoice, Memo, and PRQ documents. Which Customer should this change impact?  All customers using the new Approval Workflow feature toggle. Important Notes: The new workflow enhancements will only be enabled for Maersk and Forest Lawn initially. This solution was tailored to address Maersk’s specific concerns. For all other customers for whom this will be turned off, the existing functionality will prevail (for both Vroozi Invoice and Purchase). What pages should this change impact?  Company > Workflow > Approval Matching Technique Which users should be impacted by the change?  Admins. How should this change work? Pre-Requisites: Conditions in AC #2 are fulfilled. The Financial Approval Workflow is enabled by the Admin. UI Design for Approval Matching Technique Settings Add a new section with  title  called as - “ Approval Matching Technique ”. Add a  short description  below the title - “This setting determines the method by which approval rules are applied to documents.” Add a  sub-title  below this description - “ Choose how would you like to match approvals: ” Add  2 options  below the sub-title - “Approve based on the first line item's accounting combination.” Add  tooltip  besides Option  (a)  - “ The system assigns approval rules based on the accounting combination found in the first line item of the document, without considering other line items. ” “Approve based on the accounting combination with the highest total amount across all line items.” Add  tooltip  besides Option  (b)  - “ The system evaluates all unique accounting combinations across all line items, including individual split accounting combinations. It selects the accounting combination with the highest total amount and assigns the corresponding approval rule. ” Template : You can design something like this. It doesn’t have to be exactly this way. Please ensure that this section blends seamlessly into the Workflow page. If you have a better way of displaying the above settings, please feel free to share your suggestions. UI Implementation of Approval Matching Technique Settings Approval Matching Technique  settings should  only  be visible when the client is using the new Dynamic Approval Workflow. The system should  only  allow the Admin to select  one  option at a time. When the new Dynamic Approval Workflow is turned  ON  for the  first time  for a client, the system should select  Option (a)  by default. BE Implementation of Approval Matching Technique Settings Option (a)  - “ Approve based on the first line item's accounting combination. ” Utilize the original implementation that was developed according to the Original MVP ticket -    Option (b)  - “ Approve based on the accounting combination with the highest total amount across all line items. ” Implement the new Approval rule matching logic introduced in this ticket -    Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  No. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All. Questions : Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date             FYI -   /   /

epic.summary: Enhancement of Terms & Conditions Management and Assignment in Purchase Orders
epic.description: Description Objective: This Epic aims to significantly enhance the Terms & Conditions (T&Cs) management and assignment functionalities in our system, addressing specific needs of our clients, Yukon and Maersk. The primary goal is to provide flexibility and control in the creation, assignment, and management of T&Cs for Purchase Orders (POs), both auto-generated and manually created. Key Features: Admin Capabilities for T&Cs Management: Enable Company Admins to author and manage multiple custom T&Cs. Provide functionality to set default T&Cs and associate custom T&Cs with specific suppliers and/or company codes. Dynamic T&Cs Assignment: Automate the assignment of correct T&Cs to POs based on supplier and/or company code. Buyer Permissions & Capabilities: Empower Buyers with permissions to edit T&Cs on POs, including the use of a rich text editor for ad-hoc T&Cs, with options to save these either for single-use or in their profile for future reuse. PO Change Request (POCR) Enhancements: Implement functionality for Buyers to update T&Cs on POs via POCR, with tracking of changes in the document history UI. Restricted Access for Requesters: Prevent the original requester from altering T&Cs on POs through the POCR function. Admin Overrides and Approvals: Allow Admins to modify T&Cs on POs via POCR, subject to Buyer approval for manually created/transmitted POs. Stakeholders: Primary: Yukon and Maersk Vroozi Divisions: Management, Sales / Marketing, Customer Success, Implementation, Support, Product, Engineering Vroozi Functional teams: Purchase Team, Payables Team ( — ?), Integration Team ( ?) Timeline and Milestones: Start Date: ASAP Completion Target: May 2024, within Q2 2024 Dependencies and Risks: Application Roles Effected : Company Admins, Buyers Payables Team Cooperation: Required for updating POs in the Supplier Portal. Integration Team Involvement: Potential need for integrating T&Cs communication via cXML POs, which could impact project timeline. Success Criteria: Effective implementation of T&Cs management and assignment system enhancements. Improved flexibility and control for Admins and Buyers in handling T&Cs. Seamless integration with existing systems and processes. Positive feedback from primary stakeholders, Yukon and Maersk. Milestones: MVP - Minimum Viable Product: Product manager to validate assumptions and solution design with stakeholders. Engineering to complete    MUP - Minimum Useable Product:                                     Purchase Order: Allow Buyers to create and associate Ad-hoc T&Cs to a specific PO Purchase Order: Print the correct T&Cs on the PO PDF Vroozi Admin: Allow Admins to specify whether PO T&Cs can be updated via the POCR function POCR: Allow only the “PO Owner” to update T&Cs via POCR POCR: Record and display T&Cs changes done on a PO, in the PO Document Change History Integration team  → SPIKE: Integration team needs to investigate impact on NBCU, if T&Cs can be updated vai POCR Payables team  → Supplier Portal: Display PO T&Cs in the Vroozi Supplier Portal Payables team  → Supplier Portal: Ensure SP users are able to Confirm / Dispute T&Cs changes on a PO updated via POCR MLP - Minimum Lovable Product: Vroozi Admin: Figure out how to introduce an “Apply to All” option for associations SPIKE: Investigate how we can compute, store and display a fine grained “Diff” for the T&Cs content, when updated by an Admin         Integration team  →     POCR: Allow Admins to update the T&Cs on a PO via POCR POCR: Allow Central Reciever to update the T&Cs on a PO via POCR POCR: Ensure that T&Cs updates on POs; done via POCR, are reviewed and approved by the “PO Owner” Vroozi PMAN: Allow Buyers, Admins, Central Receivers to create custom T&Cs and save them in their user profile for reuse at a later date Vroozi PMAN: Allow users to view and manage their custom T&Cs from their “My Data” screen   The wireframes for this project can also be found here:

issues.summary: Vroozi Admin : Allow Admins to designate 1 of their custom T&Cs as the unitID default T&Cs
issues.description: Business Case: Since unitID Admins now have the ability to create custom T&Cs for their company account, we need to allow them to configure one of these as the default T&Cs for their unitID. We want a default set in place, because we do not want a situation where the unitID is configured to use custom T&Cs, the system ends up sending out a PO without any T&Cs added to it. In order to accomplish this, this ticket is going to introduce a few capabilities into the system:  Ensure that when the 1st set of custom T&Cs is created in the unitID, those T&Cs are automatically set as the unitID’s default choice.  Ensure that the user is able to change the unitID’s default set of custom T&Cs to another one that has already been created in the unitID.  There need to be multiple avenues for the user to be able to do this.  Acceptance Criteria: Prerequisites: If the feature flag added in   has not been removed from the system. Then the unitID MUST have this feature flag enabled. The data table defined in   must have already been developed, so that any custom T&Cs that are created, can be displayed in it. Admins should already be able to create new T&Cs in the unitID, as described in   .   Impacted Vroozi Roles Which user roles within the Vroozi Admin system will be affected by this change? PMAN Admin Data-Fix Necessity Will there be any requirement for data migration or transformation as part of this change? TBD … If required, please provide details of what the expected effect of this data fix will be: TBD … Set as “default” option on Create/Edit modal TBD …   to add a mockup for this UnitID default T&Cs - Configured UnitID default T&Cs - Change from drop-down UnitID default T&Cs - Change from action column NOTE:  The mockups provided above will be updated at a later date to reflect the documented requirements below. Allow the Admin to set default T&Cs from the Create T&Cs modal: Add a new checkbox/toggle on the UI for creating a new set of T&Cs introduced in   .  This new checkbox/toggle should be located  <TBD> This checkbox/toggle should have the label “ Set as default T&Cs “ When creating the 1st set of custom T&Cs in the unitID: This checkbox/toggle should be in the “Checked“/“On” state by default The user should NOT be able to change the state of this checkbox/toggle When the user saves the new set of T&Cs, the system should automatically set these T&Cs as the unitID default When creating/editing the “nth” set of custom T&Cs in the unitID: This checkbox/toggle should be in the “Unchecked“/“Off” state by default The user SHOULD be able to change the state of this checkbox/toggle When the user saves the new set of T&Cs and this checkbox/toggle is disabled, the system should not make any change to the default T&Cs for the unitID When the user saves the new set of T&Cs and this checkbox/toggle is enabled, the system should automatically set these T&Cs as the unitID default Allow the Admin to change the unitID default T&Cs from the T&Cs management screen drop-down: There should be a drop-down above the new table added in    This drop-down should be aligned with the right edge of the table, and should vertically be inline with the T&Cs configuration drop-down ( the one with the “Custom Terms & Conditions” option in it ) This drop-down should be labeled “ Default Terms & Conditions: “ By default; when there are NO custom T&Cs in the unitID, this drop-down should be empty As soon as the 1st set of custom T&Cs is created in the unitID, and set as the default, this drop-down should reflect that updated unitID status When the user clicks into this field, they should see a default list of avalaible active custom T&Cs from their unitID By default, this list should include upto  <TBD>  number of options The user should also be able to search through all active custom T&Cs in their unitID, by typing out it’s name.  This field should behave like a type-ahead field, being triggered after the user enters 2 chars The user should be able to change the unitID’s default T&Cs by selecting an available set from this field.  Allow the Admin to change the unitID default T&Cs from the actions column: In the “actions” cell ( the right-most cell in each row of the data table ), there should be 2 action buttons The 1st button should use a square with a checkmark in it ( see the attachment titled “ Screenshot 2024-03-07 at 1.26.09 PM.png “ ) This icon should only be visible against T&Cs in the data table, that are not currently set as the unitID’s default T&Cs Clicking on this should change the unitID’s default T&Cs to the T&Cs listed in that specific row of the data table.  This change should be reflected immediately in the drop-down field mentioned above, and should also update the visibility of the “ square with a checkmark “ icon for that row The 2nd button should use the standard trash-can icon for deletion used across the application. (Functionality related to this icon will be documented in   )   Question Answer Q asked by … Q asked on … A provided by … A provided on … When a user opens the Terms & Conditions (T&C) modal in edit mode, the default T&C toggle should not be set in read-only mode if it's already configured as the default ?  Case #1:  The toggle for controlling whether a set of T&Cs is the unitID default, should be in read-only mode, if the T&Cs that the user is looking at is set as the unitID default, and is the ONLY set of custom T&Cs in the system. The reason being, that in this case, we DO NOT want the user to unset these T&Cs as the unitID default. Case #2: If there are more than 1 sets of custom T&Cs in the unitID, then if the user opens up the editing modal for one that has already been set as the unitID default. Then the toggle should be in the “ On ” state, and it SHOULD be in read-only mode. If we don’t do this, the user could unset these T&Cs as the default, without a replacement unitID default. This will create a scenario where the unitID has no default.

issues.summary: System : Backend service to record & maintain an audit history of changes made to the custom T&Cs collection
issues.description: Business Case: Maintaining an accurate and comprehensive record of all changes made to custom Terms & Conditions (T&Cs) is crucial for operational transparency, compliance, and auditability. The implementation of a background service designed to capture and log every modification to the custom T&Cs within a unitID addresses several critical needs within the organization: By systematically recording who made changes, when these changes were made, the method used for the changes (API, bulk upload, UI), and the specific nature of the changes, the organization can ensure a higher level of compliance with internal policies and external regulatory requirements. This comprehensive change log will serve as an essential tool for audits, offering a clear trail of modifications for accountability and verification purposes. Additionally, in instances of errors or disputes regarding the custom T&Cs, having a detailed history of changes can expedite resolution. By identifying when a change was made and by whom, it is easier to trace back through the decision-making process, understand the context of the modifications, and, if necessary, correct errors or address disputes more efficiently. Finally, in the future, by analyzing the change logs, the organization can identify patterns or trends in the modifications of the T&Cs, which can inform future improvements to the contract management processes, training needs for users, or enhancements to the T&Cs themselves. Acceptance Criteria: Prerequisites: If the feature flag added in   has not been removed from the system. Then the unitID MUST have this feature flag enabled. The data table defined in   must have already been developed, so that any custom T&Cs that are created, can be displayed in it. The T&Cs creation function defined in   must have already been developed, so that at the very least the creation event can be recorded.    Impacted Vroozi Roles Which user roles within the Vroozi Admin system will be affected by this change? PMAN Admin Vroozi Reporting & BI functions Data-Fix Necessity Will there be any requirement for data migration or transformation as part of this change? TBD … If required, please provide details of what the expected effect of this data fix will be: TBD … This BE service should record the following information about changes to the custom T&Cs in a given unitID:  Which user modified a given set of custom T&Cs What time did they make this change Which avenue did they use to effect this change: Admin Panel UI Bulk Upload File Vroozi Public API What was the change they made: Creation Editing Change in PO attribute associations Change in T&Cs content, including name & description Deleting Activation Deactivation The event details must be recorded at a granular level.  Which field was updated What was the old value in that field What was the new value in that field

issues.summary: Vroozi Admin : Allow Admins to Edit existing custom T&Cs
issues.description: Business Case: Since Admins now have the ability to create new custom T&Cs for their unitID, they must also have the ability to edit them once they’ve been created.  Acceptance Criteria: Prerequisites: If the feature flag added in   has not been removed from the system. Then the unitID MUST have this feature flag enabled. The data table defined in   must have already been developed, so that any custom T&Cs that are created, can be displayed in it. Admins should already be able to create new T&Cs in the unitID, as described in   .   Impacted Vroozi Roles Which user roles within the Vroozi Admin system will be affected by this change? PMAN Admin Data-Fix Necessity Will there be any requirement for data migration or transformation as part of this change? TBD … If required, please provide details of what the expected effect of this data fix will be: TBD … Edit existing custom T&Cs screen The mockups above will be updated at a later date   When should the user see the new T&Cs creation modal? Admins must be able to create a new set of custom T&Cs from within the unitID's  Documents → Settings → Purchase Orders  screen’s “ Terms & Conditions “ management section. When the Admin clicks on the “ Name ” of an existing set of T&Cs in the T&Cs management screen   What should the user see the on the T&Cs editing modal? This modal should be titled “ Edit Custom Terms & Conditions “ This modal should include fields called " Name " and " Description ”. Both of these fields should be populated with the relevant values stored in the DB for this set of T&Cs.  The system must support rich text editing for the T&Cs content to allow for detailed and formatted contractual language. Under the T&Cs content, this modal should also display controls to associate the T&Cs with specific suppliers or company codes. These controls should have the label “ Associate these T&Cs with: “ If this set of T&Cs had any associations stored with it, those should be pre-populated here by default. If no associations were previously stored with this set of T&Cs, then the system should display the placeholder text “ These Terms & Conditions are not currently associated to any PO attributes. Please click on the “+“ to specify any desired associations. “ There should be a clickable “ + ” button under this placeholder text. When the user clicks on this button, the placeholder text should be replaced by UI controls to allow the association of these T&Cs with PO attributes. These controls should be layed out in 2-columns, where the 1st column is titled “ Purchase Order Attribute “ and the 2nd one is titled “ Values “. The 1st column should display a single select drop-down; with the following options for now: Company Codes Supplier When a new row is added, neither of the options mentioned above should be selected by default. The 2nd column should display a multi-select type-ahead field By default, this field should be inactive, until the user makes a selection in the 1st field. There should be a “x”, or trash can button to the right of the 2nd input control. There should be a “ X ” button in the top-right corner of this modal. Clicking this should just close the modal, without modifying the state of the system. There should be 2 action buttons in the footer of this modal. The first button should be a “ Cancel ” button, which should functionally behave in an identical manner to the “ X ” button at the top of the modal. The 2nd button should be a “ Save ” button, which, when clicked will save the user’s provided information, and update the system state accordingly.   What is the minimum/required set of data/information that a user MUST provide, when creating a set of custom T&Cs? At a minimum, the user MUST provide data in the following fields on this modal, in order for the “ Save ” button to become active and clickable: A Name for the set of custom T&Cs being created. Content for the set of custom T&Cs being created.   What additional, optional data can the user provide , when creating a set of custom T&Cs? Optionally, the user can also provide the following information about the set of custom T&Cs being created: A Description for the set of custom T&Cs being created. The Suppliers and/or Company Codes that the set of custom T&Cs should be associated with.   Is there any user specified information on a set of custom T&Cs that will be used as a uniqueness constraint in the T&Cs management system? The system should ensure that any set of custom T&Cs that’s being created, should be unique within the unitID. This uniqueness check should be based on the T&Cs name. If the user tries to save a set of custom T&Cs that has the same name as an existing set, then the system should not allow the user to save that set when the “ Save ” button is clicked. Instead, the user should be shown an error message under/above the “ Save ” button. This message should read “ Oops! Another set of custom T&Cs with the same name already exists. “ Should the uniqueness check be case sensitive or not? Follow whatever pattern is the standard across the system.   How should the Company Code and/or Supplier association controls work on this modal? The first field should be a single select type ahead, and the user should only have 2 options in it;  Company Codes  and  Suppliers . If the user selects the  Company Codes  option, the 2nd field should be a multi-select type ahead. This field should show all the active company codes in the unitID. Any company codes that have already been selected in this field, should not be part of the list of options presented to the user. Each selected option should be listed in the field as a “ pill ” with a “ x ” in order to remove it as a selection. If the source data for one of these selections is deactivated, or deleted from the unitID, the next time the Admin is looking at this field, that particular selection should be highlighted orange, with a “?” in the pill. This field should show all the active suppliers in the unitID. Any suppliers that have already been selected in this field, should not be part of the list of options presented to the user. Each selected option should be listed in the field as a “ pill ” with a “ x ” in order to remove it as a selection. If the source data for one of these selections is deactivated, or deleted from the unitID, the next time the Admin is looking at this field, that particular selection should be highlighted orange, with a “?” in the pill. Hovering over the “?” should let the user know that this value is no longer available in the unitID. The user should NOT be able to create more than 1 row of associations across the same PO attribute. The “ + ” button should always remain visible, allowing the user to add additional rows of associated attributes. The “ + ” button should become disabled if the user adds rows of associations for all available PO attributes.     Question Answer Q asked by … Q asked on … A provided by … A provided on … Validate and approve the messages added for the following scenarios:  - When an existing set of T&Cs is successfully updated in the DB: " Item {{ items }} has been updated. " Change the message to “ {{ items }} has been updated successfully. ” Provide a message to display on the UI, in case there is a technical error preventing an existing set of T&Cs from being updated. issues.summary: Vroozi Admin : Allow Admin to create new custom T&Cs
issues.description: Business Case: The current system limitation only allows for the management of a single, predefined set of Terms & Conditions (T&Cs) for each unitID, restricting administrative flexibility and responsiveness to changing contractual requirements. This enhancement aims to introduce a feature enabling the creation, management, and assignment of multiple sets of custom T&Cs within each unitID. This functionality is critical for accommodating diverse and evolving contractual obligations specific to different suppliers or scenarios. By allowing for the dynamic creation of custom T&Cs, the system will empower administrators to tailor contractual language to specific needs, improving compliance, and operational efficiency. What’s wrong with the current UI?   The current UI is only meant to handle a single set of custom T&Cs for a unitID. It displays a single rich text editor, which allows the Admins to define the custom T&Cs that the unitID will use. This bakes in the assumption that there will always be just one set of T&Cs that will be used across all POs that the unitID issues to all suppliers.  What value will the updated UI bring? This new UI will be inspired by other master data creation/editing interfaces used in the application. This will enable the creation and editing of an arbitrary number of custom T&Cs that an Admin might want to maintain for the unitID.   Acceptance Criteria: Prerequisites: If the feature flag added in   has not been removed from the system. Then the unitID MUST have this feature flag enabled.  The data table defined in    must have already been developed, so that any custom T&Cs that are created, can be displayed in it.    Impacted Vroozi Roles Which user roles within the Vroozi Admin system will be affected by this change? PMAN Admin Data-Fix Necessity   Will there be any requirement for data migration or transformation as part of this change? TBD … If required, please provide details of what the expected effect of this data fix will be:  TBD … Change this …  To this …                                                                                + Ignore the tab bar from the wireframe diagram for the scope of this ticket. When should the user see the new T&Cs creation modal? Admins must be able to create a new set of custom T&Cs from within the unitID's  Documents → Settings → Purchase Orders  screen’s “ Terms & Conditions “ management section. When the Admin clicks on the “ Add T&Cs ” button, the system should open up a new modal dialogue.  What should the user see the on the new T&Cs creation modal? This new modal should be titled “ Create Custom Terms & Conditions “ This modal should include fields called " Name " and " Description ” The name field should be limited to < TBD > number of chars The description field should be limited to < TBD > number of chars The system must support rich text editing for the T&Cs content to allow for detailed and formatted contractual language. Under the T&Cs content, this modal should also display controls to associate the T&Cs with specific suppliers or company codes. These controls should have the label “ Associate these T&Cs with: “ By default, there should  NOT  be any additional attributes associated to the set of custom T&Cs being created. Instead, there should be the placeholder text “ These Terms & Conditions are not currently associated to any PO attributes. Please click on the “+“ to specify any desired associations. “ There should be a clickable “ + ” button under this placeholder text.  When the user clicks on this button, the placeholder text should be replaced by UI controls to allow the association of these T&Cs with PO attributes.  These controls should be layed out in 2-columns, where the 1st column is titled “ Purchase Order Attribute “ and the 2nd one is titled “ Values “. The 1st column should display a single select drop-down; with the following options for now: Company Codes Supplier When a new row is added, neither of the options mentioned above should be selected by default. The 2nd column should display a multi-select type-ahead field By default, this field should be inactive, until the user makes a selection in the 1st field.  There should be a “x”, or trash can button to the right of the 2nd input control. There should be a “ X ”  button in the top-right corner of this modal. Clicking this should just close the modal, without modifying the state of the system.  There should be 2 action buttons in the footer of this modal.  The first button should be a “ Cancel ” button, which should functionally behave in an identical manner to the “ X ” button at the top of the modal.  The 2nd button should be a “ Save ” button, which, when clicked will save the user’s provided information, and update the system state accordingly.  What is the minimum/required set of data/information that a user MUST provide, when creating a set of custom T&Cs? At a minimum, the user MUST provide data in the following fields on this modal, in order for the “ Save ” button to become active and clickable:  A Name for the set of custom T&Cs being created.  Content for the set of custom T&Cs being created.  What additional, optional data can the user provide , when creating a set of custom T&Cs? Optionally, the user can also provide the following information about the set of custom T&Cs being created:  A Description for the set of custom T&Cs being created.  The Suppliers and/or Company Codes that the set of custom T&Cs should be associated with.  Is there any user specified information on a set of custom T&Cs that will be used as a uniqueness constraint in the T&Cs management system? The system should ensure that any set of custom T&Cs that’s being created, should be unique within the unitID.  This uniqueness check should be based on the T&Cs name.  If the user tries to save a set of custom T&Cs that has the same name as an existing set, then the system should not allow the user to save that set when the “ Save ” button is clicked. Instead, the user should be shown an error message under/above the “ Save ” button. This message should read “ Oops! Another set of custom T&Cs with the same name already exists. “ Should the uniqueness check be case sensitive or not?  Follow whatever pattern is the standard across the system.  How should the Company Code and/or Supplier association controls work on this modal? The first field should be a single select type ahead, and the user should only have 2 options in it;  Company Codes  and  Suppliers . If the user selects the  Company Codes  option, the 2nd field should be a multi-select type ahead.  This field should show all the active company codes in the unitID.  The company code’s code + description should be shown here Any company codes that have already been selected in this field, should not be part of the list of options presented to the user.  Each selected option should be listed in the field as a “ pill ” with a “ x ” in order to remove it as a selection.  If the source data for one of these selections is deactivated, or deleted from the unitID, the next time the Admin is looking at this field, that particular selection should be highlighted orange, with a “?” in the pill. Hovering over the “?” should let the user know that this value is no longer available in the unitID.  If the user selects the  Supplier  option, the 2nd field should be a multi-select type ahead.  This field should show all the active suppliers in the unitID.  The Display Name from the supplier record should be shown here Any suppliers that have already been selected in this field, should not be part of the list of options presented to the user.  Each selected option should be listed in the field as a “ pill ” with a “ x ” in order to remove it as a selection.  If the source data for one of these selections is deactivated, or deleted from the unitID, the next time the Admin is looking at this field, that particular selection should be highlighted orange, with a “?” in the pill. Hovering over the “?” should let the user know that this value is no longer available in the unitID.  The user should NOT be able to create more than 1 row of associations across the same PO attribute.  The “ + ” button should always remain visible, allowing the user to add additional rows of associated attributes.  The “ + ” button should become disabled if the user adds rows of associations for all available PO attributes.  Question Answer Q asked by …  Q asked on … A provided by … A provided on … Should the duplicate check logic be case sensitive or not? Use whatever pattern we’re following throughout the rest of the system.           you have mentioned rich text editor for T&Cs text. Do we need to test the entire functionality of the toolbar of rich text editor in the scope of this ticket? No, that shouldn’t be necessary. As long as the FE devs are using the same component as we use today, you guys can just do basic regression testing against that component.    Mar 13, 2024      Is the editing of the newly created T&Cs also comes in the scope of this ticket? No. Editing will be covered in a different ticket.      Mar 13, 2024     Validate and approve the messages added for the following scenarios:  - When a new set of T&Cs is successfully added in the DB: " New terms and conditions added successfully " Change the message to “ New Terms & Conditions added successfully “.         Provide a message to display on the UI, in case there is a technical error preventing a new set of T&Cs from being created.  Use the message “ Oops! Something went wrong. Unable to create the specified set of Terms & Conditions. Please try again later. “

issues.summary: Payables: Approval WF: Admin can download the bulk upload error report
issues.description: Business Case : As an Admin, I want to see the error report if there are any issues in the Approval Rule Bulk Upload file. Acceptance Criteria : What is the change?  Admin should be able to download the error report if there are any issues while uploading the Approval Rule Bulk upload file. Which Customer should this change impact?  All customers using the new Approval Workflow feature toggle. What pages should this change impact?  Company > Workflow > Approval Rules. Which users should be impacted by the change?  Admins. How should this change work? If there are any type of errors in the bulk upload file or processing failure, the system should show a red exclamation: Hovering on the icon should show a tooltip saying  Download Error Report . Clicking on the  Download Error Report  icon should download the error report. The system identifies the errors after processing the file : If there are invalid records in the columns of the approval rules bulk upload file, the system should mention them in the error report as per the existing standard of bulk upload error report. Please refer to the following pattern. Row# of the file. Header of the file (if missing all together) Issue(s) that causes the error. If there are multiple errors for a single row, all errors should be visible in a separate row. The Processing Failure : The system supports bulk upload file in .XLSX format. If the user tries to upload the file in a format the system does not support, there should be a processing failure report. The error report in the PDF should say “Invalid file format. Kindly download the template and use that file format for bulk upload.“ If the user removes any required column from the bulk upload file or provides an invalid column name, the system should provide those details in the PDF error report. Each error should be accommodated in a separate row in case of multiple errors. Other types of Errors that can happen : Duplicate Rule Name with different Condition(s). Two rules with same combination of Condition(s). Two rules with overarching combination of Condition(s), like one rule has catch all condition that covers rule two’s condition as well. Users without Approver role for PR, CR, and PRQ documents. Users without AP Approver role for Invoices and Memo documents. Invalid Condition(s) - Inactive or deleted accounting objects. Invalid Approver(s) - Inactive or deleted Approvers. Note: Create the Approval Rule Bulk Upload Error Report template similar to how it works for Users / Suppliers error report. Description added below was updated on 2/27/2024 to improve clarity on this ticket. - Error Message templates : Missing Header Error : “[Column Name]” column is missing. Column Name – Row_Number Applies_To Rule_Name Rule_Description Missing Data Error : Missing data in the “[Column Name]” column. Column Name – Row_Number Applies_To Rule_Name Rule_Description Missing Condition(s) Error : At least one condition is required for this rule. Missing Approver(s) Error : At least one Approver and their Approval limit are required for this rule. Invalid Data Error : Invalid data found in “[Column Name]” column for “[Data in the column for this rule]”. Column Name – Row_Number Applies_To Company_Code Plant Cost_Center GL_Account Location Project L1_Approval_Limit L2_Approval_Limit Etc. Invalid Status Error : Invalid status value provided in the “[Status]” column. Please ensure that the status column contains valid values (E.g., Active, Inactive) Duplicate Row Error : Duplicate row found for rule name “[Rule_Name]” in the uploaded file. Please remove or correct the duplicate entry.  ( Moving this error message to this ticket -   ) Invalid Condition(s) Error : Inactive or deleted data “[Data in the column for this rule]” found in the “[Column Name]” column(s) for this rule. Column Names – Company_Code Plant Cost_Center GL_Account Location Project Invalid Approver Error : Inactive, deleted or non-existing user “[user in the column for this rule]” found in the “[Column Name]” column(s) for this rule. Column Names – L1_Approver L2_Approver L3_Approver Etc. Role Requirement Error : Approver “[user in the column for this rule]” in “[Column Name]” column does not have the required role (Approver) for the specified Applies_To values “[PR, CR, PRQ]” Approver “[user in the column for this rule]” in “[Column Name]” column does not have the required role (Accounts Payable Approver) for the specified Applies_To values “[Invoice, Memo]” Approver “[user in the column for this rule]” in “[Column Name]” column does not have the required role (Approver or Accounts Payable Approver) for the specified Applies_To values “[PR, CR, PRQ, Invoice, Memo]” Duplicate Approver Error : Invalid user “[user in the column for this rule]” found in the “[Column Name]” column(s) for this rule. Column Names – L1_Approver L2_Approver L3_Approver Etc. Please utilize all those error messages also that we have currently implemented, on the UI, for various validation related use cases . Regarding the Error Report icon, I agree that we should retain the icon until a new Bulk upload file has been uploaded .  (NEW - 3/28/2024) When a Bulk upload file is uploaded and the system detects error(s) in the file, an Error Report should be generated. Upon opening the Error Report, the Error Report icon should  persist  on the Approval Rule page, allowing the Admin to revisit the Error Report if necessary. The Error Report icon should  disappear  if a new Bulk upload file is uploaded  without  any error(s). If a new Bulk upload file is uploaded and error(s) are  detected , the Error Report icon should  refresh  with a new Error Report. Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  No. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All. Questions : Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date If Row_Number is missing for a Rule, then how should we notify the user that this specific line has an error message?    Ahmed  2/28/2024  Sujoy

issues.summary: AccVal: Copy-Item on POCR: The system should run the validation when a line item is copied on the POCR screen.
issues.description: Business Case: The system should run accounting validation when a line item is copied on the POCR. When a Line Item is copied on the POCR: Existing Implementation of Copy Line Item: When a user copies a line item, a new line item is added to the document. The new line item has all the fields filled in with the values provided for the copied line item. General Rule for Running the Accounting Validation at Document Creation: Currently, the system requires the definition of the required and optional Accounting/Organization objects in the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service . If the value in the optional field is given at the line item, the system considers it for the accounting validation in addition to the required fields. If the value in the optional field is not given at the line item, the system considers only the values in the required fields at the line item for the accounting validation. Based on that, the system decided what fields should be compared in the accounting validation with the accounting string master data. Copy Item on POCR: When the user copies the item from the POCR, the system should create a new item on the PR with the same values. ( existing implementation ) While creating a new line item via Copy Item on the POCR: The following red highlighted point is not applicable on POCR. The system should not run the accounting validation if it does not find values in at least all the required fields for the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service . In that case, the system should show the missing fields error message according to the document-level field configuration. The system should run the accounting validation for copied and newly created line items if it finds values in at least all the required fields for the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service . The system should show the  Validating Data  with  In Progress  icon on the line item grid as defined in    If the system finds no accounting string errors, the system should save the state in the DB. If the system finds the accounting string errors, the system should save them in the DB. The system should show the accounting strings error message box above the line item grid. The system should run the accounting validation for copied and newly created line items if it does find values in all the required and optional fields for the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service . The system should show the  Validating Data  with  In Progress  icon as defined in    If the system finds no accounting string errors, the system should save the state in the DB. If the system finds the accounting string errors, the system should save them in the DB. The system should show the accounting strings error message box above the line item grid. The following user can do the copy item on PR. So all of the mentioned-above AC should be implemented for them: Admin Requester Buyers Central Reciever(QA, Please confirm this)   This user have option to copy line item on POCR.( Verified by QA)

issues.summary: AccVal: Add Item via Bulk Upload: The system should run the validation while adding an item to PR from Bulk Upload
issues.description: Business Case: The system should run the accounting validation when the PR is created via Bulk Upload. Acceptance Criteria: Existing Implementation of adding item to PR via Bulk Upload: The user clicks the  Uplaod Item(s)  button from the PR screen. A window appears, where the user select the file from the system or clod storage. A push notification appears at the bottom right corner of the screen telling the user that the file is in progress. Line item(s) is added to the PR Line Item Grid if the file is processed without errors. The notification tells the user that the file is processed successfully. If the file is processed with errors, Line Item(s) is added to the PR with the errors. The notification tells the user that the file is processed with errors. There is a link. Clicking on that navigates the user with the newly created PR. There is another link. Clicking on that downloads the error report for the user. While Creating the PR, the system prioritizes the accounting and organization objects' values in the BOM file. The system checks the user’s profile for accounting and organization objects' values if not found. If not found, the system leaves those fields empty. General Rule for Running the Accounting Validation at Line Item Modal: Currently, the system requires the definition of the required and optional Accounting/Organization objects in the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service . If the value in the optional field is given at the line item, the system considers it for the accounting validation in addition to the required fields. If the value in the optional field is not given at the line item, the system considers only the values in the required fields at the line item for the accounting validation. Based on that, the system decided what fields should be compared in the accounting validation with the accounting string master data. Add Line Item via Bulk Upload: The system adds the item(s) to the PR it is added via Bulk Upload. While adding an item to the PR via bulk upload: The system should not run the accounting validation if the system does not find at least all the required fields for the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service  based on the existing priority logic to find and assign accounting and organization objects to the line item of the PR. In that case, when the requester opens(loads) the PR, the system should show the missing fields error message according to the document-level field configuration. The system should run the accounting validation if it does find values in at least all the required fields for the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service  based on the existing priority logic to find and assign accounting and organization objects to the line item of the PR. If the system finds no accounting string errors, the system should save the state in the DB. If the system finds the accounting string errors, it should save them in the DB. The system should show the error message box above the line item grid. The system should run the accounting validation if it does find values in all the required and optional fields for the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service  based on the existing priority logic to find and assign accounting and organization objects to the line item of the PR. If the system finds no accounting string errors, the system should save the state in the DB. If the system finds the accounting string errors, it should save them in the DB. The system should show the error message box above the line item grid. In case some line items in bulk upload file have values in all the required and optional fields for the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service  based on the existing priority logic to find and assign accounting and organization objects to the line item of the PR and some line items have not values in at least all the required fields for the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service , the system should run the accounting validation for the items having values in all the required and optional fields for the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service . For line items with values in all the required and optional fields: If the system finds no accounting string errors, the system should save the state in the DB. If the system finds the accounting string errors, it should save them in the DB. The system should show the error message box above the line item grid. User with Coding Restrictions: The system should ignore the values of accounting and organization objects from the bulk upload file if a user with coding restrictions tries to add the line item to PR via bulk upload with accounting and organization objects given in it. ( Existing Implementation )  The system should look into the user profile to get the values of the accounting and organization objects. ( Existing Implementation )  The system should not run the accounting validation if the system does not find at least all the required fields for the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service  from the user profile. In that case, when the requester opens(loads) the PR, the system should show the missing fields error message according to the document-level field configuration. The system should run the accounting validation if it does find values in at least all the required fields for the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service  from the user profile. If the system finds no accounting string errors, the system should save the state in the DB. If the system finds the accounting string errors, it should save them in the DB. The system should show the error message box above the line item grid. The system should run the accounting validation if it does find values in all the required and optional fields for the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service  from the user profile. If the system finds no accounting string errors, the system should save the state in the DB. If the system finds the accounting string errors, it should save them in the DB. The system should show the error message box above the line item grid.

issues.summary: Vroozi API - Update endpoints for catalog custom field/content-views associations
issues.description: Change required for the PUT endpoints of catalog custom field from "remove" to "disassociate"  Objective:  To enhance clarity and align with best practices, update the endpoints for disassociating custom fields in the catalog API. Changes: Rationale:  The change in endpoint terminology is proposed to align with industry-standard naming conventions and provide a clearer representation of the intended action. Using "disassociate" accurately reflects the operation of detaching custom fields from catalogs without implying removing. Endpoint 1: Current:   PUT /catalogs/{id/externalId}/custom-fields/remove Proposed:   PUT /catalogs/{id/externalId}/custom-fields/disassociate Reasoning:  The term "disassociate" more accurately reflects the action of removing a custom field from a catalog without implying deletion. Endpoint 2: Current:   PUT /catalogs/name/{name}/custom-fields/remove Proposed:   PUT /catalogs/name/{name}/custom-fields/disassociate Reasoning:  Consistency is maintained by using the term "disassociate" in the URL, ensuring clarity and coherence in the API design. Impact Analysis: Backward Compatibility:  The changes are backward compatible, ensuring existing integrations using the old endpoints will not be affected. Documentation Update:  The API documentation will need to be updated to reflect the new endpoint URLs. Testing:  Ensure thorough testing of the updated endpoints to verify correct functionality. Change Required for the PUT endpoints of catalog content views from "remove" to "disassociate" Objective:  To enhance clarity and align with best practices, update the endpoints for disassociating content views in the catalog API. Changes: Rationale:  The change in endpoint terminology is proposed to align with industry-standard naming conventions and provide a clearer representation of the intended action. Using "disassociate" accurately reflects the operation of detaching custom fields from catalogs without implying removing. Endpoint 1: Current:   PUT /catalogs/{id/externalId}/content-views/remove Proposed:   PUT /catalogs/{id/externalId}/content-views/disassociate Reasoning:  The term "disassociate" more accurately reflects the action of removing a  content-views  from a catalog without implying removing. Endpoint 2: Current:   PUT /catalogs/name/{name}/content-views/remove Proposed:   PUT /catalogs/name/{name}/content-views/disassociate Reasoning:  Consistency is maintained by using the term "disassociate" in the URL, ensuring clarity and coherence in the API design. Impact Analysis: Backward Compatibility:  The changes are backward compatible, ensuring existing integrations using the old endpoints will not be affected. Documentation Update:  The API documentation will need to be updated to reflect the new endpoint URLs. Testing:  Ensure thorough testing of the updated endpoints to verify correct functionality.

epic.summary: Accounts Payable: Approval Workflow Enhancements 2023-2024: Phase-II

issues.summary: PMAN: AP: System supports additional fields under Condition(s) in the Workflow Rule definition
issues.description: User Story: As an Admin , I want to use additional parameters to route my documents for approval  so that  we can ensure a 100% compliance with our business process and attain efficiency through the workflow automation. Acceptance Criteria: 1.  What is the change?  The system supports the inclusion of additional Organization and Accounting fields in the workflow rules definition. 2.  Which customers should this change impact?  All customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true  and  the new workflow rules feature toggle = true. Important Notes:   The new workflow enhancements will only be enabled for Maersk and Forest Lawn initially. For all other customers for whom this will be turned off, the existing functionality will prevail (for both Vroozi Invoice and Purchase). 3.  What pages should this change impact?  The Company → Workflow page. 4.  Which users should be impacted by the change?  Admins. 5.  How should this feature work? Pre-Requisites:   Conditions in AC #2 are fulfilled. The Financial Approval Workflow is enabled by the Admin. Admin creates a new rule or updates an existing rule: When they add a new field under Condition(s)  or  click on an existing field’s drop down, they are able to select any of the following new fields presented in the drop down: Note:  The Admin is able to select any of the below fields as the first condition. The system displays the  custom labels  of the below fields in the drop down if they’ve been configured by the Admin. WBS Element,  if activated. Internal Order,  if activated. Profit Center,  if activated. Class,  if activated. Customer,  if activated. Purchasing organizations. Special Case (See below for more details) : Location Type,  if activated. Value :  The Admin is able to filter any  undeleted  and  active  values of the selected field. How NEW accounting elements should work  - All 4 Accounting Categories ( Cost Centers ,  WBS Elements ,  Internal Orders  and  Profit Centers ) should be available when a new Rule is created. Admin can  only  choose 1 Accounting Category in an Approval Rule, at a time. The other 3 Accounting Categories should become hidden so that the  Admin  cannot select these categories in the Field section later. Location Type   should be a field that can only be selected if - Location Type selected in the Approval Rule belongs to a Company Code that satisfies the below condition. Company Code has Location Type required = Yes. Classes  - Can be linked to Single, Multiple or All Company Codes. Purchasing Organizations  - Can be linked to Single or All Company Codes. Customers  - How is the Customer field field filtered on all documents? Lets keep the dependencies between the Customer and Company Code. GL Account and other Accounting Categories should be available based on the Company Code selected for this approval rule. Customer Data used by current clients in Production ( for reference ) - Client Company Code Accounting Categories GL Account Maersk Yes Yes Gradient Yes Delta Fuel Yes Ednovate Yes Custom Goods Yes Yes (sometimes individually) Yes (sometimes individually) ICE Yes USJ Yes Yes NBCU Yes Yes BAA Yes Search Filtering : Admin should be able to search for the new Accounting elements in the Search filter section. Narrow search by: WBS Element,  if activated. Internal Order,  if activated. Profit Center,  if activated. Class,  if activated. Customer,  if activated. Location Type,  if activated. Purchasing organizations. Workflow Rule matching : The system should consider  new  Accounting elements while matching documents ( such as Invoices, Memos, & Payment Requests ) . Please refer to this ticket for existing matching rule implementation that we are looking to develop in the Mini-Release (RC-2024-2.1.0) -   6.  Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  Yes, as new fields are being added to the workflow rules. 7.  Would this change impact existing documents?  Potentially no. But existing workflow rules will be impacted as a result of AC #6. 8.  To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. Questions: Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date 1 5 Deepak October 20, 2023  /    # Question Recommendation Response Remarks 1 How is the Customer field field filtered on all documents? 2 When should we implement the BE validation logic to disallow more than one Accounting Categories  suggests to implement it as part of upload ticket      I would implement it as part of this ticket, so we already have the error, and re-use it in the bulk upload (Jimena) Key Decisions: # Decision Point Decision Reasoning Validation Plan 1 Should we support Purchasing Organizations? 2 Should we support Location Type? 3 Should we use the Default Class field in Location to filter Classes? } Below is the high-level starting flow with main classes involved to understand design structure and implement accordingly: Acceptance Criteria: A new feature toggle named ‘ INTELLIGENCE__INVOICE_EXCEPTION_HANDLER ’ should be added to allow for this feature to be TURN ON/OFF at company level. If this feature is enabled, a new settings should be available in Accounts Payable > Settings > Preferences section, where admin can enable/disable this options for their company. Rename current ML settings to  Apply Machine Learning to invoice line-items   for coding New settings will be called Apply Machine Learning to invoice for exception handler If this new settings is disabled, there should be no changes to the current flow and no model endpoint should be called for prediction. If this new settings is enabled, During invoice processing, when there is an exception, the system should be able to make a call to model endpoint with provided mapping details and display appropriate resolution with confidence score to the user. AP Processor User should see new button as shown in the mock below to see the suggested exception resolution per line that has non-GR related exceptions which should be shown as follow. Clicking on the Suggest Resolution(s) button  should get the resolutions for non-GR related exceptions from Model Endpoint and display resolutions to AP Processor with confidence score.  AP Processor User should be able to see the confidence score by clicking on the bulb icon as shown below. Note: For the lightbulb icons, we will follow the current color scheme that we already use for Vroozi Intelligence: Blue - resolutions with >= 90% confidence Orange - resolutions with < 90% confidence However, if AP processor decides to submit the exceptions for manual exception handling by clicking on the Submit For Exception Handling button, the invoice should be moved to Exception state and Suggest Resolution(s) button should not longer be available for AP processor to avoid conflict in resolutions from AI/Manual process. After the Model suggested resolutions, AP processor should be able to either Accept or Reject resolutions by clicking on Reject/Accept button after the resolution has been provided. The confirmation dialog should be shown when user clicks on the Accept  button as it is today. The exceptions should be resolved after user clicks on Yes, Accept button and invoice should be moved to next step for Approval, whereas canceling should make no changes. If AP Processor User is not happy with the model suggested resolutions, he should be able to reject the resolution by clicking on Reject button before submitting it for manual exception handler. Upon rejecting, the invoice should be moved back to DRAFT and Submit For Exception Handling button should be available again. After rejection, AP processor should be able to see the Suggest Resolution(s) button again, along with Submit For Exceptin handling button and decide to either submit for manually exception handling or make modification to invoices and re-generate model suggested resolutions by clicking on Suggest Resolution button.  When invoice is submitted for manual exception handler, the exception handler should also be able to see the Suggest Resolution(s) button along with Bulb Icon showing all the model suggested resolutions with confidence for each exceptions. Clicking on the Suggest Resolution(s) button should then apply the top resolutions for each exception and a new Clear Resolution(s) button should appear. AP Exception Handler User should be able to clear suggested AI resolutions by clicking on Clear Resolution buttons. Exception Handler should be able to submit exception resolutions back to the AP Processor as it is today after resolutions is selected. Once the resolution is provided by Exception Handler, AP Processor should be able to Accept or Reject the resolutions (existing functionality) Scenarios   Note:  All the above flow should be applicable for all types of PO based invoices that contains non-GR exception including cXML invoices as well as auto invoice processing flow.

issues.summary: PMAN: User Should Be Instantly Logged Out If Admin Deactivates Or Deletes The Account
issues.description: Business Case: The system should log out the Sourcing, Financial, and Budget Approver if the Admin deactivates or deletes their account. Acceptance Criteria:  If an approver is logged in and the admin deactivates or deletes the logged-in approver’s account in the meantime, the system should immediately log out the approver as soon as they take any action. This should be implemented for the following approvers Sourcing Financial Budget Initially it was created as a bug for the budget approver. after investigation, it turned out that this is a gap that persists from the beginning for all the approvers. Therefore, we converted it into a story. For the original bug, below are the steps to reproduce. Steps to Reproduce: Login as budget approver on Devqa-2 Login as admin , go to User Management Inactive the budget approver  Create the budget from the budget approver Actual Result: Budget is created successfully Expected Result: User should be instantly logout when user is Inactive Screen-shot:
